author: John Sinclair
comment: Does what you would imagine.  I set up my groups then set up individual bulbs as their own group so I have compete control via Wear. Only complaint /request is that can't do white's via Wear..? Can this be looked at please Dev?
title: Almost perfect

comment: Definitely the most beautiful and simplistic hue app out there but crashes alot. Works nicely with Android wear but crashes whenever I try to open the alarms tab. Would get 5 stars from me if that bug was fixed.
title: Good but buggy

author: Chad Dierkes
comment: Nice app, fairly simple. I love that there is an Android Wear app though, just wish there was more control of individual lamps on the watch. App does suffer from random crashes on Nexus 5X as well.

author: Chris Ellerbeck
comment: Crashed when selecting the Hub and is missing several bulbs. Several. The room info in the JSON should be used as a starting group, having to create all the rooms from scratch is a pain. ...and maybe not have the menu text in fuchsia.

author: Girish Kamath
comment: Works as advertised. If your group is not showing up on your Android Wear, try deleting and re-creating the group. That did the trick for me. One feature it lacks is state synchronization.

author: Romain Louon
comment: Works perfectly when it works, but will crash every few hours. If you want to use this to control your lights with Android Wear, expect to at least turn the app on once on your phone every night.

author: patrick soler
comment: Change the color of your lights from your watch. The easiest color selector I've seen, great job!
title: Just what I wanted

author: Si Row
comment: Great App but keeps crashing! !

author: Stuart Burch
comment: Couldn't connect to the bridge. Reinstalled the app. Seems to work again.

author: Tony B.
comment: Great job!
title: Simple and to the point.

author: Austin Wolcott
comment: But it's not finding my bridge anymore...
title: Great App

author: Adam Mohammed
comment: This is such a nicely designed app. I recently updated the app but I am still experiencing issues, specifically the crashes that happen whenever I open the app. I have a Nexus 5x running 6.0.1. I do appreciate the fact that the developer communicates to us about new bug fixes so I am hopeful that there will be an update to fix this issue in the near future.
title: Nice app but crashes still happen!!!

author: Blaine Maksymetz
comment: I recently purchased a Hue starter kit and the Phillips app doesn't integrate with Android Wear at all.  This app is exactly what I was looking for.

author: Nathan Anderson
comment: New Android Wear integration is awesome. First party developers have no excuse for poorly designed and functioning apps when well built ones like this are available.

author: Aaron Senn
comment: I am very excited with the potential of this app, but it still has plenty of issues that keep it from a higher rating.
title: Great potential, plenty of bugs.

author: Ari Sarousi
comment: It was a great app, but now it can't find my bridge. No choice but to uninstall.

author: Eli Grey
comment: I'm unable to enter my bridge address, as this app strips colons from my input, preventing me from specifying a port when editing a bridge address (my bridge is not on port 80). The app also doesn't allow me to manually enter my bridge address during setup (necessary if the bridge is on another network).
title: Doesn't work

author: Cédric Servay
comment: Works well.  Looks good.  No permissions that are creepy and useless. Love it
title: Love it

author: Eric Anderson
comment: Intuitive design and great price.
title: Very nice

author: Miad Hoque
comment: Bright is a clean and pleasing interface to control your Hue lights. The first proper use of material design in a Hue app which is an important thing in something that is going to see daily usage! Even has a dark mode!
title: What Phillips should have made

author: Psi Iota
comment: After updating my Samsung G925P to marshmallow, the errors have been innumerable. Over 7000 in one week. Outstanding.
title: Love the app, but way too many errors.
